description.summary: Conspiracy theory alleging reptilian humanoid aliens secretly control Earth, particularly through shapeshifting into positions of power. Promoted mainly by David Icke since the 1990s.
description.full: The Reptilian conspiracy theory alleges that reptilian humanoid aliens secretly control Earth and humanity. Popularized by British conspiracy theorist David Icke from the 1990s onward, the theory claims these beings can shapeshift to appear human and have infiltrated the highest levels of power, including royal families, politicians, and the so-called 'Illuminati.' The reptilians are portrayed as malevolent entities manipulating human society. The concept has roots in 1930s pulp science fiction but gained conspiracy traction in Icke's work. The theory has been widely criticized for containing antisemitic tropes, particularly in its targeting of banking families and global elites. No credible evidence supports the existence of reptilian aliens. The theory is considered a harmful conspiracy belief that has influenced real-world actions and violence.

related_phenomena.description: Different alien species in conspiracy lore

features.description: Scaled skin, reptilian eyes, sometimes tails

physical.morphology: Claimed to be humanoid with reptilian characteristics including scales, vertical slit pupils, and cold-blooded physiology.

abilities.description: Claimed ability to appear fully human

range.description: Conspiracy theory is global; alleged reptilians claimed to control worldwide

origins.cultural_roots: Pulp science fiction of 1930s-1940s; conspiracy theory development in 1990s
origins.earliest_accounts: Science fiction stories featuring reptilian aliens
origins.folklore_connections: Some superficial connections to dragon/serpent mythology exploited by conspiracy theorists

timeline.significance: Early fictional depictions of reptilian humanoids
Influential depiction of reptilian aliens disguised as humans
Aliens secretly controlling society (not reptilian but influential)
Major popularization of reptilian conspiracy theory
Theory spreads widely online, influencing conspiracy culture

history.modern_era: The reptilian conspiracy theory continues to circulate online and has influenced broader conspiracy movements. It has been linked to real-world harassment and violence, and is widely rejected by mainstream society and experts.

video.name: Various alleged 'shapeshifting' videos
video.description: Videos claiming to show reptilian features briefly visible
video.analysis: Video compression artifacts, lighting effects, pareidolia. No genuine evidence.

skeptical.name: Science Fiction Influence
skeptical.description: Conspiracy theory draws heavily on sci-fi sources like V, They Live, and pulp fiction

skeptical.name: Antisemitic Tropes
skeptical.description: Theory recycles antisemitic conspiracy tropes with alien overlay

skeptical.name: Psychological Phenomenon
skeptical.description: Pattern recognition, pareidolia, and conspiracy thinking create perceived evidence

skeptical.name: No Evidence Whatsoever
skeptical.description: Zero credible evidence for reptilian aliens
evidence_cited: Violation of known biology and physics

folklore.beliefs: No legitimate folklore basis; some conspiracy theorists inappropriately cite dragon/serpent mythology.

indigenous.sensitivity_note: Some conspiracy theorists inappropriately invoke Indigenous or ancient cultures. These claims are fabricated.
indigenous.respect_guidelines: Do not conflate legitimate cultural traditions with conspiracy theories.

research.ongoing_studies: Scholars study the conspiracy theory as a cultural and psychological phenomenon, not as a potentially real phenomenon.
